channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OR

item.title: Report X-2023090761
item.description:
Report X-2023090761

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-01
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED FOR LEAKING PACKAGE. RESPONDER FOLLOWED DECISION TREE PROCESS, RESPONDER ALSO DISCOVERED SODIUM HYDROXIDE, BEADS INSIDE PACKAGE. RESPONDER NOTIFIED RMP FOR SUSPECTED UNDECLARED. RMP CALLED HMSC. PHOTOS TAKEN HELD FOR ADG COMPLIANCE RELEASE/INSTRUCTION.

item.title: Report X-2023090741
item.description:
Report X-2023090741

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-13
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2023090741: AT LEAKER DISCOVERY LOCATION" LEAKING PACKAGE CAME DOWN THE CONVEYOR BELT. BELT WAS STOPPED, NOT TOUCHED, MOVED AWAY, PICK-OFF NOTIFIED SUPERVISOR. RESPONDER CONTAINED AND PROCESSED THROUGH DMP. X-2023090742: UPON CLEAN UP AND INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED THE OUTSIDE OF THE BOX WAS WET FROM A LEAKING BOTTLE INSIDE BUT NO OTHER LIQUID WAS PRESENT ON THE GROUND. X-2023090743: RESPONE TO LEAKER AT DOOR, RESPONDER FOUND LEAKING HAZMAT IN UN SPECIFICATION FIBERBOARD BOX CONTAINING FOUR PLASTIC 1 GALLON BOTTLE. RESPONDER FOLLOWED DECISION TREE TO CLEAN UP CORROSIVE LEAKER AND TAKE BACK TO PSC.

item.title: Report X-2023090758
item.description:
Report X-2023090758

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: HILLSBORO
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: LEAKING PACKAGE WAS CALLED FOR AT 5:52AM. RESPONDER CONTAINED LEAKER, CLEANED UP SPILL, AND TOOK THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE PSC FOR FURTHER INSPECTION. THE SIGHT OF THE AEROSOL CAN AND THE BOX HAVE NO HAZARDOUS MATERIALS MARKINGS PROMPTED AN SDS SEARCH. THE LEAKER WAS SEARCHED IN EDMP AND AN SDS SEARCH RESULTED IN FINDING IT TO BE AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT. THE HMSC WAS CALLED AND THE PRODUCT PROCESSED IN EDMP.

item.title: Report X-2023090756
item.description:
Report X-2023090756

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE PSC WAS CALLED AND A RESPONDER WAS DISPATCHED TO THE UNLOAD, DOOR 35. THE RESPONDER GOT TO THE DOOR AND A IRREG SWEEPER INFORMED THE RESPONDER THAT THE IRREG HAD AN ODOR COMING FROM IT BUT WAS UNSURE WHAT WAS WRONG WITH IT. THE RESPONDER COULD SEE THAT THE CORNER OF THE PACKAGE WAS TORN AND COULD SEE INSIDE THE PACKAGE AND COULD IDENTIFY THE INNER CONTAENTS AS "RUST-OLEUM, EPOXY SHIELD". THE RESPONDER ALSO NOTICED THE ODOR COMING FROM THE PACKAGE. WHEN MOVING THE PACKAGE THE RESPONDER COULD TELL THE PACKAGE WAS WELL OVER THE 70 POUNDS LISTED ON THE LABEL. THE WEIGHT AND ODOR MADE THE RESPONDER SUSPECT IT WAS AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT.WHEN RETURNING TO THE PSC THE RESPNDER NOTIFIED THE NIGHTSORT RMP THAT THEY POSSIBLE HAD AN UNDECLARED.THE RMP LOOKED UP THE SDS AND IN SECTION 14 OF THE SDS THE PRODUCT STATES AS THE PROPER DOT SHIPPING NAME"PAINT PRODUCTS IN LIMITED QUANTITES". THE RMP NOTIFIED HMSC TO BEGIN PROCESSING AS A POTENTIAL UNDECLARED HAZMAT.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: item left at QA for 24 hours intil 4:19 pm on 8/28/23 when process began item found to have loose lid causing contents of one package to leak no other damage detected to remainind 3 bottles DescribePack: loose lid DurationRel: 24 and MitigateEffect: item was placed in haz drum all paper work filed

item.title: Report X-2023081962
item.description:
Report X-2023081962

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: TROUTDALE
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: I found the original outer packaging in recycle bin, soaked and still had the Hazardous materials shipping papers still on one side. Shipping label and Dimond labels were removed from original outer packaging. As we do not dispose of contaminated packaging in this manner, I checked the paperwork for TRK # and looked up the Ftrack. There was a 10 Scan on 08/25/23 and nothing else till 08/26/23 at around 1am. there was no DPR done or a 40 scan for repack and inspection. I have no information about how the original package was found or the condition it was in or if there was any inner packaging, I could tell by the original packaging that the inner containers had been leaking. I was able to locate the repacked contents inspect them. Upon inspection I found 2 contains were still wet and one container was missing a noticeable amount of liquid compared to the other. There was also noted wetness on the other inner package box. And it had been tapped over. Wet outer packaging was placed in a beg. I tightened the caps on the containers and placed all outer and inner packaging in a bag inside a yellow hazmat bin. I performed a DPR and ISF once I found the repacked Hazmat containers. DescribePack: As I have no information on the original packaging, the only thing I can say for sure is that the caps were loose on the inside containers. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Unknown

item.title: Report I-2023080028
item.description:
Report I-2023080028

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-15
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: LEAKER DISCOVERE AND EMPLOYEE CALLED RESPONDER. RESPONDER DISCOVERED AFFECTED PACKAGE OPENED ON THE FLOOR. THERE WERE 2 RED CYLINDER FIRE EXTINGUISHERS INSIDE. UPON INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED PACKAGE WAS NOT MARKED AS A HAZMAT. RESPONDER CLEANED AND BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO BE PROCESSED. RESPONDER TALKED TO THE HAZMAT AUDITOR AND CONTACTED ADG COMPLIANCE.
